column4: Analyze /var/log/Xorg.0.log.old . In particular grep for "EE" and report here these errors.
just a minute booting into recovery console to access the log
the file doesn't have enough information about the error
to be precise it doesn't have any information about the error
Hm. May be dmesg will reveal more about this freeze.
from the recovery console i am able to access the X without any issues by typing startx
ACPI Exception: AE_NOT_FOUND, Evaluating _DOD (20110112/video-1139)
dmesg reveled that info
let me know if you want my system info
This seems to be related to your problem. Please google for this error, may be in addition to your computer type. --  I personally do not know this error.
okay let me give a try, i happened to me when using 10.10. Today morning i installed a fresh copy of 11.04 but still the error persists
So your hardware peculiarities play a role, I guess.
how do i find my graphics card related info?
'~$ lspci | grep VGA'
its not giving me the graphic card model etc. it just says 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Core Processor Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 02)
Is your computer very old? I only know more meaningful output of this command.
no upgraded it on Dec 2010
mine has i5 processor and inbuilt intel video graphics card

My graphic card knowledge comes to an end with your information. May be the information "00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Core Processor Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 02)" is sufficient for experts. You can try to google for the dmesg error message and this "00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Core Processor Integrated Graphics Controller...
...(rev 02)" data. May be that obtains a clue as to what configure in your computer to overcome the freeze. If not, please ask a more knowledgeable person.
thanks i will google it and try to solve it
